January 1, 2022


Decarceration and Public Health Emergency Credits

The COVID-19 pandemic showed the urgency of decarceration. New Jersey's Public Health Emergency Credits law gave us a model for how we can begin to do it on a larger scale. Read more.

Leaked Supreme Court Opinion on Roe v. Wade

The decision of when and whether to have a child is a fundamental human right, and the U.S. Supreme Court's potential actions on Roe v. Wade threaten to upend core autonomy and privacy rights in many parts of our country. We're fighting back. Read more.

How Algorithmic Systems Can Affect the Lives of All New Jerseyans

Automated systems are prone to arbitrary and biased decision-making. The ripple effects of algorithmic injustice can be felt across the state and in nearly every domain. Read more.

Education Rights while in Prison

Young people with disabilities have a legal right to a free and appropriate public education, even when they are incarcerated. But for years, the educational needs of high school students in New Jersey's state prisons were not being met. That's changing now, and Brian Y. is a big reason why. Read more.

A Q&A with Deputy Director and Chief Operating Officer Carla Chávez

Expanding the ACLU of New Jersey team is an essential step in working toward the organization's vision of building a just and fair New Jersey. To mark this expansion of leadership, we spoke with Carla about her new role and her vision for the future of the ACLU-NJ. Read more.

You're Invited: Raising the Bar with Retired NJ Supreme Court Justice Jaynee LaVecchia

On Tuesday, June 28, the ACLU of New Jersey will bring together attorneys who have argued in recent and notable cases – as well as our distinguished guest, the honorable retired New Jersey Supreme Court Justice Jaynee LaVecchia – for a discussion on the state of civil rights at New Jersey's highest court. CLE credits available. Register now.

Show your P-R-I-D-E with Madewell

Visit Madewell at The Grove at Shrewsbury on Saturday, June 18, between noon and 4 p.m. 10% of all sales during that time will benefit the ACLU of New Jersey. RSVP.
